30DaysActivity 30 Days: Baguio City Parks Activities Week 1: Burnham Park Adventures Day 1: Morning jog around Burnham Park Lake
A jog around the lake in the early morning can boost your mental state and improve your energy levels for the day. Day 2: Practice yoga or tai chi on the park lawns
Yoga or tai chi activities can help you relax and reduce stress. Day 3: Sketch or paint the scenic views of the park
Paint your favorite area in the park, use any medium you want and be expressive. Take your time in building your art. Day 4: Have a picnic under the trees with family or friends
Time to bring some friends or family with you and have a picnic under the trees. Bring your favorite snacks and drinks that you have been saving at home. Day 5: Bird watching and identifying local species
There are many local species of birds flocking around the lake on quiet days. Try visiting in the morning for a calmer experience with bird watching. Day 6: Join or form a morning exercise group
Various groups are seen exercising the park in the morning, try joining one and make friends in the process. You may also form a group of your own with your new friends. Day 7: Capture the sunset with your camera or smartphone
Afternoons are perfect for experiencing a busier side of the park as residents pass by to enjoy the park after a day of working or school. This is also a good time to witness the setting sun wrap the park in an orange glow. Week 2: Botanical Garden Bliss Day 8: Explore the different plant species in the Botanical Garden

There are many plant variations in the area, there are also multiple greenhouses that showcase exotic plant life in this park. Try exploring them all Day 9: Meditate in one of the quiet corners of the garden

A quiet spot is your destination for today, find the perfect spot among the trees and the greens to let your mind and body relax. Day 10: Participate in a group walk or nature hike

This park is still worth exploring, bring along some people to share the moment with. Learn about the history of this place with a group walk or nature hike. Day 11: Draw or photograph the various flowers and plants

A visit to this park is not complete without some hand drawn memoirs. Art can heal, art is a therapy. Day 12: Read a book in a peaceful spot within the garden

Bring your favorite book and read it in a quiet spot within the garden. Day 13: Volunteer for a garden clean-up activity
Volunteer with your friends and help maintain the park by cleaning up the garden. This is the perfect time to appreciate the beauty of nature with your friends while doing something for it. Day 14: Map out and label the gardenâ€™s key areas and features

Your last day in the park for this month can be spent by strengthening your mental image of this place. Try to create a map of this place complete with labels, add this to your memorabilia. Week 3: Camp John Hay Escapes Day 15: Discover the eco-trails and go for a hike

Set out on the famous eco-trails, this is a good way to start your week in the city. Day 16: Play outdoor games like frisbee or badminton

This place is a good choice for some outdoor activities like badminton or frisbee. Try your best to play outdoor games to rekindle that youthful feel. Day 17: Have a storytelling session in the amphitheater

Have a go at the amphitheater's story-telling sessions. Children and adults are invited to take part in the storytelling sessions. Day 18: Organize a tree-planting activity with friends

Make the most of your visit by having a tree-planting activity with your friends. Day 19: Go stargazing at night within the park

This place has a great view at night, try the hill for a great view of the skies. Day 20: Listen to local tales and legends from elders

Invite people who can share stories of the old times, invite young listeners as well to participate and get inspired with the history. Day 21: Identify and document different tree species

Explore the multiple trees in the area, you might be surprised that there other trees aside from pine trees. Week 4: Mines View Park and more" Day 22: Enjoy the panoramic views from Mines View Park

Like a tourist, simply enjoy the view in the view deck of Mines View Park. Day 23: Draw or take photos of the stunning landscapes

There are wonderful areas to explore among these parks, choose your favorite spot and be creative in preserving that moment. Day 24: Participate in a mindfulness walk

Walk with your friends towards the park. A good starting place would be the central business district area. Take your time and don't hurry, Baguio is a walkable city after all. Day 25: Have an early morning stretching routine with a view

This time, jog towards the park. But don't forget to stretch first. Day 26: Listen to the sounds of nature and practice mindful listening

Choose your favorite park, or go for small ones you haven't visited yet and just sit quietly listening to the sounds of nature. Day 27: Collect fallen leaves and create art from them

Bring out your creativity and create a unique art from the fallen leaves. But don't just stop there, use twigs and pine cones as well if you like. Day 28: Write poetry or short stories inspired by the surroundings

Go channel your inner poet, write poetry or short stories inspired by the places you have visited. Day 29: Organize a clean-up drive within the park

Organize another clean-up drive for a park of your choosing. Keep the surroundings clean, remember, every effort towards a healthier and cleaner city is appreciated. Day 30: Reflect on your month of activities and journal about your experiences

This is it! A whole month buzzed quickly by, but you're a changed person now. Write something about your experience or create a short video about it and share it with the world.
